news.title: Investigation launched after man seriously injured during interaction with garda in Dublin city centre
news.summary: A young garda is at the centre of a major investigation by the office of the Police Ombudsman after the officer allegedly pushed a 51-year-old man who suffered critical head injuries after he fell on the street.

news.title: ‘They don’t care about dogs or alarms’ – gardaí identify six nationwide burglary gangs working from Dublin and Kildare area
news.summary: Gardaí have identified six main burglary gangs that drive from their bases in Dublin and Kildare to break into homes and businesses nationwide.

news.title: Tony Holohan drops Áras bid as he wants to protect family from ‘personal abuse’ in Irish politics
news.summary: Fine Gael MEP Seán Kelly is defying the hopes of the party hierarchy for a single presidential candidate after refusing to clear the way for Heather Humphreys by ruling out a run for the Áras.

news.title: Funeral of Martha Nolan-O’Slatarra to take place later this week in Co Carlow
news.summary: The funeral of an Irish woman found dead on a boat in the United States will be held in her native Carlow later this week.

news.title: Who will be the Rose of Tralee 2025? Seven Roses to watch out for over the next two days
news.summary: After a five-day-long tour across Ireland and two parades through the streets of Tralee, all 32 Roses are set to hit the stage at MTU’s Sports Academy in Kerry.

news.title: Volodymyr Zelensky arrives at White House for ‘historic’ summit in bid to end Russia’s invasion of Ukraine
Pat Spillane: There’s a first for everything, and when it comes to the 2025 All-Ireland, I’ve only good things to say
news.summary: It still came as a jolt to me when it was stated on the 9pm news that the camogie final had brought the curtain down on the inter-county GAA season.

news.title: Jet setting, sport, fun and festivals: Here’s what your favourite Irish celebrities have been up to this summer
news.summary: Summer might be on its way out, but the mid-August heatwave has come along to remind us that there’s still plenty of fun to be had. Here’s what Irish celebrities and public figures have gotten up to thus far.

news.title: British government warns Sally Rooney could be committing terror offence after Irish author backs Palestine Action
news.summary: Normal People author Sally Rooney risks committing a terrorist offence if she funds banned organisation Palestine Action, the British government has warned.

news.title: Ask Allison: My relationship with my sisters has become more strained since they had children
news.summary: I have two sisters whom I love very much. We are all close in age, in our 30s and early 40s. We socialise a lot together and love visiting our family home. In the past three or four years, both of my sisters have had children.
